articles.title: Tjeckiska fraser f√∂r att s√§ga 'Jag saknar dig' ‚Äì Uttryck l√§ngtan p√• tjeckiska
articles.content:
Tjeckiska har poetiska s√§tt att uttrycka saknad. L√§r dig ber√§tta f√∂r din partner att de alltid finns i ditt hj√§rta.

## Tjeckiskas poetiska l√§ngtan

Tjeckien har en rik tradition av romantisk litteratur som √•terspeglas i spr√•kets k√§rleksfulla uttryck.

## Grundl√§ggande fraser

### "Chyb√≠≈° mi"
**Uttal:** HI-beesh mi

**Betydelse:** Jag saknar dig (du saknas mig)

### "Moc mi chyb√≠≈°"
**Uttal:** mots mi HI-beesh

**Betydelse:** Jag saknar dig s√• mycket

### "Po≈ô√°d na tebe mysl√≠m"
**Uttal:** PO-rzhaad na TE-be MIS-leem

**Betydelse:** Jag t√§nker st√§ndigt p√• dig

## Djupare uttryck

### "M√© srdce po tobƒõ tou≈æ√≠"
**Uttal:** meh SRD-tse po TO-byeh TOW-zhee

**Betydelse:** Mitt hj√§rta l√§ngtar efter dig

### "Ka≈æd√° minuta bez tebe je vƒõƒçnost"
**Uttal:** KAZH-daa mi-NU-ta bez TE-be ye VYETCH-nost

**Bedeutelse:** Varje minut utan dig √§r en evighet

### "Bez tebe se c√≠t√≠m ne√∫pln√Ω/ne√∫pln√°"
**Uttal:** bez TE-be se TSEE-teem ne-UP-lnee/ne-UP-lnaa

**Betydelse:** Utan dig k√§nner jag mig ofullst√§ndig

## Romantiska kv√§llsfraser

### "Chyb√≠ mi us√≠nat vedle tebe"
**Uttal:** HI-bee mi U-see-nat VED-le TE-be

**Betydelse:** Jag saknar att somna bredvid dig

### "Postel je pr√°zdn√° bez tebe"
**Uttal:** POS-tel ye PRAZD-naa bez TE-be

**Betydelse:** S√§ngen √§r tom utan dig

### "Chyb√≠ mi tv√© teplo vedle mƒõ"
**Uttal:** HI-bee mi tveh TEP-lo VED-le mnye

**Betydelse:** Jag saknar din v√§rme bredvid mig

## Vardagliga uttryck

### "Dnes jsem vidƒõl nƒõco, co mi tƒõ p≈ôipomnƒõlo"
**Uttal:** dnes sem VI-dyel MNYE-tso tso mi tye PRZHI-pom-mnye-lo

**Betydelse:** Idag s√•g jag n√•got som p√•minde mig om dig

### "Chyb√≠ mi na≈°e mal√© chvilky"
**Uttal:** HI-bee mi NA-she MA-leh HVIL-ki

**Betydelse:** Jag saknar v√•ra sm√• stunder

### "V≈°echno mi tƒõ p≈ôipom√≠n√°"
**Uttal:** FSHEKH-no mi tye PRZHI-po-mee-naa

**Betydelse:** Allt p√•minner mig om dig

## Hoppfulla fraser

### "Nem≈Ø≈æu se doƒçkat, a≈æ tƒõ zase uvid√≠m"
**Uttal:** NE-moo-zhu se DOTCH-kat azh tye ZA-se U-vi-deem

**Betydelse:** Jag kan inte v√§nta med att se dig igen

### "Poƒç√≠t√°m dny do na≈°eho setk√°n√≠"
**Uttal:** PO-tchee-taam dni do NA-she-ho SET-kaa-nyee

**Betydelse:** Jag r√§knar dagarna till vi ses

### "Brzy budeme zase spolu"
**Uttal:** BR-zi BU-de-me ZA-se SPO-lu

**Betydelse:** Snart √§r vi tillsammans igen

## Tjeckiska smeknamn

- **L√°sko** ‚Äì K√§rlek
- **Mil√°ƒçku** ‚Äì √Ñlskling
- **Zlato** ‚Äì Guld

## Avslutande tankar

Tjeckiska ger dig poetiska s√§tt att uttrycka saknad. L√•t dina k√§nslor tala genuint.

Vzd√°lenost l√°sku neoslab√≠!

articles.title: Incontrare la Famiglia del Tuo Partner Ucraino: Guida Completa
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Incontrare la famiglia del tuo partner ucraino √® un momento importante. Gli ucraini hanno un forte senso della famiglia e fare una buona impressione pu√≤ significare molto per la vostra relazione.

## Prima dell'Incontro: Cosa Sapere

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–ü—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è"
  translation="Piacere di conoscervi"
  pronunciation="pry-YEM-no po-zna-YO-my-ty-sya"
  context="La frase pi√π importante per il primo incontro."
/>

<CultureTip title="Tradizioni Importanti" flag="üá∫üá¶">
In Ucraina, √® tradizione portare regali quando si visita una casa. Fiori per la madre (in numero dispari, tranne 13), dolci o cioccolatini sono sempre apprezzati. Il vino o altro alcol per il padre √® appropriato.
</CultureTip>

## Membri della Famiglia

| Ucraino | Italiano | Pronuncia |
|---------|----------|-----------|
| –º–∞–º–∞ | mamma | MA-ma |
| —Ç–∞—Ç–æ | pap√† | TA-to |
| –±–∞—Ç—å–∫–∏ | genitori | BAT'-ky |
| –±–∞–±—É—Å—è | nonna | ba-BU-sya |
| –¥—ñ–¥—É—Å—å | nonno | DI-dus' |
| —Å–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ | sorella | ses-TRA |
| –±—Ä–∞—Ç | fratello | brat |
| –¥—è–¥—å–∫–æ | zio | DYAD'-ko |
| —Ç—ñ—Ç–∫–∞ | zia | TIT-ka |

<VocabCard
  word="–í–∞—à—ñ –±–∞—Ç—å–∫–∏"
  translation="I vostri genitori"
  pronunciation="VA-shi BAT'-ky"
  example="–ö–æ–ª–∏ —è –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–ª—é—Å—è –∑ –≤–∞—à–∏–º–∏ –±–∞—Ç—å–∫–∞–º–∏?"
/>

## Presentarsi

<VocabCard
  word="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è! –ú–µ–Ω–µ –∑–≤–∞—Ç–∏..."
  translation="Buongiorno! Mi chiamo..."
  pronunciation="DOB-ro-ho DNYA me-NE ZVA-ty"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è! –ú–µ–Ω–µ –∑–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –ú–∞—Ä–∫–æ. –ü—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø –¥—É–∂–µ —Ä–∞–¥–∏–π/—Ä–∞–¥–∞ –≤–∞—Å –±–∞—á–∏—Ç–∏"
  translation="Sono molto felice di vedervi"
  pronunciation="ya DU-zhe RA-dyy/RA-da vas BA-chy-ty"
  example="–ù–∞—Ä–µ—à—Ç—ñ –º–∏ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ–ª–∏—Å—è! –Ø –¥—É–∂–µ —Ä–∞–¥–∏–π –≤–∞—Å –±–∞—á–∏—Ç–∏."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–í–∞—à–∞ –¥–æ–Ω—å–∫–∞/—Å–∏–Ω –±–∞–≥–∞—Ç–æ —Ä–æ–∑–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∞—î –ø—Ä–æ –≤–∞—Å"
  translation="Vostra figlia/vostro figlio parla molto di voi"
  pronunciation="VA-sha DON'-ka/syn ba-HA-to roz-po-vi-DA-ye pro vas"
  example="–í–∞—à–∞ –¥–æ–Ω—å–∫–∞ –±–∞–≥–∞—Ç–æ —Ä–æ–∑–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∞—î –ø—Ä–æ –≤–∞—Å. –í—Å–µ –Ω–∞–π–∫—Ä–∞—â–µ!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Forma di Cortesia" flag="üá∫üá¶">
Sempre usare "–í–∏" (Lei/Voi formale) con i genitori del partner fino a quando non ti invitano a usare "—Ç–∏". √à segno di rispetto!
</CultureTip>

## Fare Complimenti alla Casa e alla Famiglia

<VocabCard
  word="–£ –≤–∞—Å –¥—É–∂–µ –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∏–π –¥—ñ–º"
  translation="Avete una casa molto bella"
  pronunciation="u vas DU-zhe HAR-nyy dim"
  example="–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è. –£ –≤–∞—Å –¥—É–∂–µ –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∏–π –¥—ñ–º!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø–∫ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω–æ –ø–∞—Ö–Ω–µ!"
  translation="Che buon profumo!"
  pronunciation="yak SMACH-no PAKH-ne"
  example="–û–π, —è–∫ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω–æ –ø–∞—Ö–Ω–µ! –©–æ –≤–∏ –≥–æ—Ç—É—î—Ç–µ?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–í–∏ –≤–∏—Ö–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ —á—É–¥–æ–≤—É –¥–æ—á–∫—É/—á—É–¥–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ —Å–∏–Ω–∞"
  translation="Avete cresciuto una figlia/un figlio meraviglioso"
  pronunciation="vy VY-kho-va-ly chu-DO-vu DOCH-ku/chu-DO-vo-ho SY-na"
  example="–•–æ—á—É —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–∏, —â–æ –≤–∏ –≤–∏—Ö–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ —á—É–¥–æ–≤—É –¥–æ—á–∫—É."
/>

## A Tavola

### Frasi Essenziali

<VocabCard
  word="–°–º–∞—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ!"
  translation="Buon appetito!"
  pronunciation="SMACH-no-ho"
  example="La risposta a qualcuno che dice questo: '–î—è–∫—É—é!'"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–¶–µ –¥—É–∂–µ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω–æ!"
  translation="√à molto buono!"
  pronunciation="tse DU-zhe SMACH-no"
  example="–ú–º–º, —Ü—ñ –≤–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –¥—É–∂–µ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω—ñ!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ú–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —â–µ —Ç—Ä–æ—Ö–∏?"
  translation="Posso averne ancora un po'?"
  pronunciation="MOZH-na shche TRO-khy"
  example="–¢–∞–∫ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω–æ! –ú–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —â–µ —Ç—Ä–æ—Ö–∏?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ù—ñ, –¥—è–∫—É—é, —è –≤–∂–µ –Ω–∞—ó–≤—Å—è/–Ω–∞—ó–ª–∞—Å—è"
  translation="No, grazie, sono gi√† sazio/a"
  pronunciation="ni DYA-ku-yu ya vzhe na-YIV-sya/na-YI-la-sya"
  example="–í–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–π —Ü—é —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—É —Ç–∞–∫—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ - –±–∞–±—É—Å—ñ –ª—é–±–ª—è—Ç—å –≥–æ–¥—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏!"
/>

<CultureTip title="L'Ospitalit√† Ucraina" flag="üá∫üá¶">
Gli ucraini sono famosi per la loro ospitalit√†. Rifiutare il cibo pu√≤ essere visto come maleducazione. Accetta almeno un assaggio di tutto ci√≤ che viene offerto, e complimenta sempre la cuoca!
</CultureTip>

## Parlare della Relazione

<VocabCard
  word="–ú–∏ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á–∞—î–º–æ—Å—è –≤–∂–µ..."
  translation="Stiamo insieme da..."
  pronunciation="my zus-tri-CHA-ye-mo-sya vzhe"
  example="–ú–∏ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á–∞—î–º–æ—Å—è –≤–∂–µ —Ä—ñ–∫."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–í–∞—à–∞ –¥–æ–Ω—å–∫–∞/—Å–∏–Ω –¥—É–∂–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤–∞/–æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤–∏–π –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω–µ"
  translation="Vostra figlia/figlio √® molto speciale per me"
  pronunciation="VA-sha DON'-ka/syn DU-zhe o-sob-LY-va/o-sob-LY-vyy dlya ME-ne"
  example="–•–æ—á—É, —â–æ–± –≤–∏ –∑–Ω–∞–ª–∏: –≤–∞—à–∞ –¥–æ–Ω—å–∫–∞ –¥—É–∂–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω–µ."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø –¥—É–∂–µ —ó—ó/–π–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é"
  translation="La/lo amo molto"
  pronunciation="ya DU-zhe yi-YI/yo-HO ko-HA-yu"
  example="Una dichiarazione importante da fare ai genitori."
/>

## Rispondere alle Domande

I genitori ucraini probabilmente ti faranno molte domande. Ecco come rispondere:

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é —è–∫..."
  translation="Lavoro come..."
  pronunciation="ya pra-TSYU-yu yak"
  example="–Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é —è–∫ —ñ–Ω–∂–µ–Ω–µ—Ä —É –≤–µ–ª–∏–∫—ñ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω—ñ—ó."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø –∑ –Ü—Ç–∞–ª—ñ—ó, –∑ –º—ñ—Å—Ç–∞..."
  translation="Sono dall'Italia, dalla citt√† di..."
  pronunciation="ya z i-TA-li-yi z MIS-ta"
  example="–Ø –∑ –Ü—Ç–∞–ª—ñ—ó, –∑ –º—ñ—Å—Ç–∞ –†–∏–º."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–í–∏–≤—á–∞—é —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—É, –±–æ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é –≤–∞—à—É –¥–æ–Ω—å–∫—É/—Å–∏–Ω–∞"
  translation="Studio l'ucraino perch√© amo vostra figlia/vostro figlio"
  pronunciation="VY-vcha-yu uk-ra-YIN-sku bo ko-HA-yu VA-shu DON'-ku/SY-na"
  example="Questa frase far√† sciogliere i loro cuori!"
/>

## Espressioni di Rispetto

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø–∫ –≤–∏ —Å–µ–±–µ –ø–æ—á—É–≤–∞—î—Ç–µ?"
  translation="Come state? (formale)"
  pronunciation="yak vy se-BE po-chu-VA-ye-te"
  example="–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è! –Ø–∫ –≤–∏ —Å–µ–±–µ –ø–æ—á—É–≤–∞—î—Ç–µ?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å"
  translation="Grazie per l'ospitalit√†"
  pronunciation="DYA-ku-yu za hos-TYN-nist'"
  example="–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å. –£ –≤–∞—Å —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∞ —Ä–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ë—É–ª–æ –¥—É–∂–µ –ø—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è"
  translation="√à stato molto piacevole conoscervi"
  pronunciation="BU-lo DU-zhe pry-YEM-no po-zna-YO-my-ty-sya"
  example="Da dire quando te ne vai."
/>

## Piatti Tradizionali da Conoscere

Probabilmente ti offriranno piatti tradizionali. Ecco i pi√π comuni:

| Ucraino | Italiano | Descrizione |
|---------|----------|-------------|
| –≤–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–∫–∏ | varenyky | Ravioli ucraini |
| –±–æ—Ä—â | borscht | Zuppa di barbabietola |
| –≥–æ–ª—É–±—Ü—ñ | holubtsi | Involtini di cavolo |
| –∫–æ—Ç–ª–µ—Ç–∏ | kotlety | Polpette |
| —Å–∞–ª–æ | salo | Lardo (delicatezza!) |
| –ø–∞–º–ø—É—à–∫–∏ | pampushky | Panini all'aglio |

<VocabCard
  word="–Ø —Ö–æ—á—É —Å–ø—Ä–æ–±—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω—ñ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—ñ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–≤–∏"
  translation="Voglio provare i piatti tradizionali ucraini"
  pronunciation="ya HO-chu SPRO-bu-va-ty tra-dy-TSIY-ni uk-ra-YIN-ski STRA-vy"
  example="Questo mostrer√† rispetto per la cultura."
/>

## Andarsene

<VocabCard
  word="–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∏–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä"
  translation="Grazie per la bella serata"
  pronunciation="DYA-ku-yu za chu-DO-vyy VE-chir"
  example="–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∏–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä —ñ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω—É –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä—é."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–°–ø–æ–¥—ñ–≤–∞—é—Å—è, –º–∏ —â–µ –ø–æ–±–∞—á–∏–º–æ—Å—è"
  translation="Spero che ci rivedremo"
  pronunciation="spo-di-VA-yu-sya my shche po-BA-chy-mo-sya"
  example="–ë—É–ª–æ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–æ! –°–ø–æ–¥—ñ–≤–∞—é—Å—è, –º–∏ —â–µ –ø–æ–±–∞—á–∏–º–æ—Å—è."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="–ë—É–¥—å—Ç–µ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—ñ!"
  translation="State bene!/Salute!"
  pronunciation="BUD'-te zdo-RO-vi"
  example="Un saluto rispettoso per gli anziani."
/>

<CultureTip title="Dopo la Visita" flag="üá∫üá¶">
√à carino mandare un messaggio di ringraziamento il giorno dopo. Qualcosa come: "–î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ –≤—á–æ—Ä–∞—à–Ω—ñ–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä. –ë—É–ª–æ –¥—É–∂–µ –ø—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–æ." (Grazie per ieri sera. √à stato molto piacevole.)
</CultureTip>


Ricorda: i genitori ucraini apprezzano il rispetto, la sincerit√† e qualsiasi sforzo tu faccia per parlare la loro lingua. –£–¥–∞—á—ñ! (Buona fortuna!)

<CTA />

articles.title: Apprendre le danois avec des chansons d'amour
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

La musique danoise est riche et variee. Decouvrez les chansons qui vous aideront √† apprendre la langue.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Jeg elsker dig"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="yay EL-sker day"
  context="L'expression la plus chantee dans la musique danoise !"
/>

## Vocabulaire des chansons romantiques

### Mots essentiels

<VocabCard
  word="K√¶rlighed"
  translation="Amour"
  pronunciation="CH√àR-li-h√®d"
  example="Le mot le plus utilise dans les chansons"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hjerte"
  translation="C≈ìur"
  pronunciation="Y√àR-te"
  example="Mit hjerte"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dr√∏m"
  translation="R√™ve"
  pronunciation="dreum"
  example="Min dr√∏m"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="T√•re"
  translation="Larme"
  pronunciation="TO-re"
  example="Present dans les ballades"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="L√¶ngsel"
  translation="Nostalgie / Langueur"
  pronunciation="L√àNG-sel"
  example="Sentiment profond"
/>

### Expressions poetiques

| Danois | Prononciation | Fran√ßais |
|--------|---------------|----------|
| **Evig k√¶rlighed** | √à-vi CH√àR-li-h√®d | Amour eternel |
| **F√∏rste k√¶rlighed** | FEUR-ste CH√àR-li-h√®d | Premier amour |
| **Knust hjerte** | knust Y√àR-te | C≈ìur brise |
| **Stjerner** | STI√àR-ner | Etoiles |
| **Nat** | nat | Nuit |

<CultureTip title="La musique danoise" flag="üá©üá∞">
Le Danemark a une scene musicale dynamique, du folk traditionnel √† la pop electronica. Des artistes comme Aqua, M√ò, Lukas Graham ou Nephew ont marque la scene internationale. La musique danoise est souvent emotionnelle et authentique.
</CultureTip>

## Artistes √† decouvrir

### Lukas Graham

Le groupe danois au succes mondial avec ¬´ 7 Years ¬ª.

<VocabCard
  word="7 Years"
  translation="(titre anglais)"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="Leur succes mondial"
/>

### M√ò

Pop star danoise connue internationalement.

<VocabCard
  word="Lean On"
  translation="(titre anglais)"
  pronunciation="-"
  example="Collaboration avec Major Lazer"
/>

### Nephew

Groupe de rock danois tr√®s populaire au Danemark.

<VocabCard
  word="Superliga"
  translation="(nom de chanson)"
  pronunciation="SU-per-li-ga"
  example="Hit danois"
/>

### Kim Larsen

Legende de la musique danoise.

<VocabCard
  word="Papirsklip"
  translation="Decoupage de papier"
  pronunciation="pa-PIRS-klip"
  example="Chanson emblematique"
/>

## Extraits de paroles √† apprendre

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg kan ikke leve uden dig"
  translation="Je ne peux pas vivre sans toi"
  pronunciation="yay kan I-ke L√à-ve U-den day"
  example="Phrase classique des chansons d'amour"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er alt, jeg har"
  translation="Tu es tout ce que j'ai"
  pronunciation="dou √®r alt yay har"
  example="Declaration intense"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="For evigt"
  translation="Pour toujours"
  pronunciation="for √à-vit"
  example="Promesse d'amour eternel"
/>

### Vocabulaire des paroles

| Danois | Prononciation | Fran√ßais |
|--------|---------------|----------|
| **Jeg glemmer aldrig** | yay GL√àM-er AL-dri | Je n'oublierai jamais |
| **Jeg venter** | yay V√àN-ter | J'attends |
| **Jeg savner dig** | yay SAV-ner day | Tu me manques |
| **Jeg t√¶nker p√• dig** | yay T√àNG-ker po day | Je pense √† toi |
| **Jeg gr√¶der** | yay GR√àD-er | Je pleure |

## Musique traditionnelle

<VocabCard
  word="Danske sange"
  translation="Chansons danoises"
  pronunciation="DAN-ske SANG-e"
  example="Repertoire traditionnel"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="H√∏jskolesang"
  translation="Chanson de haute ecole populaire"
  pronunciation="HEU-sko-le-sang"
  example="Tradition danoise"
/>

<CultureTip title="F√¶llessang" flag="üá©üá∞">
Le ¬´ f√¶llessang ¬ª (chant communautaire) est une tradition danoise. Les Danois adorent chanter ensemble, surtout lors des f√™tes. Votre partenaire vous fera probablement decouvrir des chansons traditionnelles !
</CultureTip>

## Creer une playlist d'apprentissage

### Chansons recommandees

| Artiste | Chanson | Niveau |
|---------|---------|--------|
| Lukas Graham | 7 Years | Debutant (anglais) |
| Kim Larsen | Papirsklip | Intermediaire |
| Nephew | Superliga | Intermediaire |
| M√ò | Lean On | Debutant (anglais) |
| Gasolin' | Rabalderstr√¶de | Avance |

### Comment apprendre avec la musique

1. **Ecoutez d'abord** - Familiarisez-vous avec la melodie
2. **Lisez les paroles** - Cherchez-les sur internet
3. **Traduisez** - Comprenez le sens general
4. **Chantez** - Repetez avec la musique
5. **Memorisez** - Les phrases resteront gravees

## Expressions tirees de chansons

<VocabCard
  word="Du er mit liv"
  translation="Tu es ma vie"
  pronunciation="dou √®r mit liv"
  example="Expression romantique"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg vil altid elske dig"
  translation="Je t'aimerai toujours"
  pronunciation="yay vil AL-tid EL-ske day"
  example="Promesse d'amour"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er alt for mig"
  translation="Tu es tout pour moi"
  pronunciation="dou √®r alt for may"
  example="Declaration poetique"
/>

<CTA />

articles.title: Ingl√™s Brit√¢nico vs Americano: Diferen√ßas que Todo Casal Deve Conhecer
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Se seu parceiro fala ingl√™s, √© importante saber se ele usa ingl√™s brit√¢nico ou americano. As diferen√ßas v√£o al√©m do sotaque - vocabul√°rio, ortografia e at√© express√µes do dia a dia podem causar confus√£o! Este guia vai te ajudar a navegar essas diferen√ßas.

## Frase do Dia

<PhraseOfDay
  word="I'm keen on you (UK) / I'm into you (US)"
  translation="Estou interessado(a) em voc√™"
  pronunciation="aim kin on yu / aim in-tu yu"
  context="Duas formas de dizer que voc√™ gosta de algu√©m - uma brit√¢nica, outra americana!"
/>

## Vocabul√°rio do Dia a Dia

### Na Casa

<VocabCard
  word="Flat (UK) vs Apartment (US)"
  translation="Apartamento"
  pronunciation="flet / a-part-ment"
  example="We live in a lovely flat/apartment downtown."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Lift (UK) vs Elevator (US)"
  translation="Elevador"
  pronunciation="lift / e-le-vei-tor"
  example="Take the lift/elevator to the third floor."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Rubbish (UK) vs Trash/Garbage (US)"
  translation="Lixo"
  pronunciation="r√£-bish / trech / gar-bidj"
  example="Could you take out the rubbish/trash?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Garden (UK) vs Yard (US)"
  translation="Quintal/Jardim"
  pronunciation="gar-den / iard"
  example="Let's have dinner in the garden/yard tonight."
/>

<CultureTip title="N√£o Cause Confus√£o!" flag="üá¨üáß">
Alguns termos podem causar mal-entendidos s√©rios. No Reino Unido, "pants" significa cueca/calcinha, n√£o cal√ßa (que √© "trousers"). Nos EUA, "pants" √© cal√ßa mesmo!
</CultureTip>

## Comida e Bebida

<VocabCard
  word="Chips (UK) vs Fries (US)"
  translation="Batata frita"
  pronunciation="tchips / frais"
  example="I'll have fish and chips/fries, please."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Crisps (UK) vs Chips (US)"
  translation="Batata chips (de pacote)"
  pronunciation="krisps / tchips"
  example="Want some crisps/chips while we watch the movie?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Biscuit (UK) vs Cookie (US)"
  translation="Biscoito doce"
  pronunciation="bis-kit / ku-ki"
  example="Would you like a biscuit/cookie with your tea?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Aubergine (UK) vs Eggplant (US)"
  translation="Berinjela"
  pronunciation="ou-ber-jin / eg-plent"
  example="I'm making aubergine/eggplant parmesan tonight."
/>

## Roupas

| Brit√¢nico | Americano | Portugu√™s |
|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Trousers | Pants | Cal√ßa |
| Jumper | Sweater | Su√©ter |
| Trainers | Sneakers | T√™nis |
| Waistcoat | Vest | Colete |
| Dressing gown | Bathrobe | Roup√£o |
| Dungarees | Overalls | Macac√£o |

## Transporte

<VocabCard
  word="Boot (UK) vs Trunk (US)"
  translation="Porta-malas"
  pronunciation="but / tr√£nk"
  example="Put the bags in the boot/trunk."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Bonnet (UK) vs Hood (US)"
  translation="Cap√¥"
  pronunciation="bo-net / rud"
  example="I need to check under the bonnet/hood."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Petrol (UK) vs Gas (US)"
  translation="Gasolina"
  pronunciation="pe-trol / ges"
  example="We need to stop for petrol/gas."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Motorway (UK) vs Highway/Freeway (US)"
  translation="Rodovia"
  pronunciation="mou-tor-uei / rai-uei / fri-uei"
  example="Take the motorway/highway to get there faster."
/>

<CultureTip title="Dirigindo" flag="üá∫üá∏">
Lembre-se: no Reino Unido se dirige do lado esquerdo da rua, e o volante fica do lado direito. Nos EUA √© o contr√°rio. √ötil saber se v√£o viajar juntos!
</CultureTip>

## Diferen√ßas de Ortografia

| Brit√¢nico | Americano | Portugu√™s |
|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Colour | Color | Cor |
| Favourite | Favorite | Favorito |
| Centre | Center | Centro |
| Theatre | Theater | Teatro |
| Realise | Realize | Realizar |
| Travelled | Traveled | Viajou |
| Programme | Program | Programa |
| Defence | Defense | Defesa |

## Express√µes Rom√¢nticas

<VocabCard
  word="Fancy (UK) vs Like/Have a crush on (US)"
  translation="Estar a fim de"
  pronunciation="fen-si / laik / kresh"
  example="I fancy you (UK) / I have a crush on you (US)."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Snogging (UK) vs Making out (US)"
  translation="Beijando (de l√≠ngua)"
  pronunciation="sno-ging / mei-king aut"
  example="We were snogging/making out at the party."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Quite (UK) vs Pretty (US)"
  translation="Bastante"
  pronunciation="kuait / pri-ti"
  example="You're quite/pretty amazing, you know."
/>

## Express√µes do Dia a Dia

<VocabCard
  word="Brilliant! (UK) vs Awesome! (US)"
  translation="Incr√≠vel!"
  pronunciation="bri-li√£nt / o-s√£m"
  example="You got the job? Brilliant!/Awesome!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Cheers! (UK) vs Thanks! (US)"
  translation="Valeu!"
  pronunciation="tchirs / tenks"
  example="Cheers/Thanks for helping me!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I reckon (UK) vs I think/guess (US)"
  translation="Eu acho"
  pronunciation="ai re-kon / ai tink"
  example="I reckon/think we should leave now."
/>

<CultureTip title="Humor e Tom" flag="üá¨üáß">
Brit√¢nicos tendem a usar mais ironia e understatement. Quando um brit√¢nico diz "Not bad", geralmente significa "muito bom". Americanos costumam ser mais diretos e entusiasmados.
</CultureTip>

## Datas e N√∫meros

| Aspecto | Brit√¢nico | Americano |
|---------|-----------|-----------|
| Data | 17/01/2026 | 01/17/2026 |
| Andar t√©rreo | Ground floor | First floor |
| V√≠rgula/Ponto | 1.000,00 | 1,000.00 |

## Qual Usar?

N√£o existe certo ou errado - ambos s√£o ingl√™s! A dica √©:

1. **Seja consistente** - Escolha um estilo e mantenha
2. **Adapte-se** - Use o estilo do seu parceiro
3. **Pergunte** - Se n√£o souber uma palavra, pergunte!
4. **Aprenda ambos** - Quanto mais voc√™ souber, melhor

<CTA
  text="Quer aprender mais sobre as diferen√ßas entre ingl√™s brit√¢nico e americano?"
  buttonText="Come√ßar a Aprender Juntos"
/>

articles.title: Swedish Making Up & Reconciliation Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Swedish culture values calm, balanced communication‚Äîincluding when making up after disagreements. When your partner speaks Swedish, knowing how to reconcile in their language shows thoughtfulness. Here are essential Swedish phrases for healing and restoring harmony.

## Apologizing Sincerely

### F√∂rl√•t mig
**Pronunciation:** fer-LOHT may

**Meaning:** "Forgive me" / "I'm sorry"

**When to use it:** The most heartfelt way to apologize and ask forgiveness.

### Jag √§r verkligen ledsen
**Pronunciation:** yahg air VAIRK-lee-gen LEHD-sen

**Meaning:** "I'm really sorry"

**When to use it:** To express sincere regret.

### Jag hade fel
**Pronunciation:** yahg HAH-deh fehl

**Meaning:** "I was wrong"

**When to use it:** When taking clear responsibility.

### Jag borde inte ha sagt det
**Pronunciation:** yahg BOR-deh IN-teh hah sahkt deh

**Meaning:** "I shouldn't have said that"

**When to use it:** When regretting specific words.

## Expressing Your Feelings

### Jag hatar n√§r vi br√•kar
**Pronunciation:** yahg HAH-tar nair vee BROH-kar

**Meaning:** "I hate when we fight"

**When to use it:** To express how much conflict bothers you.

### Jag saknar dig n√§r vi √§r s√• h√§r
**Pronunciation:** yahg SAHK-nar day nair vee air soh hair

**Meaning:** "I miss you when we're like this"

**When to use it:** To express longing during tension.

### Det g√∂r ont n√§r vi √§r arga
**Pronunciation:** deh yur ohnt nair vee air AHR-gah

**Meaning:** "It hurts when we're angry"

**When to use it:** To share the emotional pain of conflict.

## Reaching Out

### Kan vi prata?
**Pronunciation:** kahn vee PRAH-tah

**Meaning:** "Can we talk?"

**When to use it:** To begin reconciliation.

### Jag vill reda ut det h√§r
**Pronunciation:** yahg vill RAY-dah oot deh hair

**Meaning:** "I want to sort this out"

**When to use it:** To show commitment to resolution.

### Kan vi b√∂rja om?
**Pronunciation:** kahn vee BER-yah ohm

**Meaning:** "Can we start over?"

**When to use it:** When you want to reset.

## Expressing Love and Commitment

### Jag √§lskar dig, det f√∂r√§ndras inte
**Pronunciation:** yahg EL-skar day, deh fer-END-rahs IN-teh

**Meaning:** "I love you, that doesn't change"

**When to use it:** To reassure your partner.

### Du √§r viktigare √§n det h√§r br√•ket
**Pronunciation:** doo air VIK-tee-gah-reh ehn deh hair BROH-keht

**Meaning:** "You're more important than this fight"

**When to use it:** To prioritize the relationship.

### Jag vill inte f√∂rlora dig
**Pronunciation:** yahg vill IN-teh fer-LOH-rah day

**Meaning:** "I don't want to lose you"

**When to use it:** To express how much the relationship means.

### Vi √§r ett lag
**Pronunciation:** vee air ett lahg

**Meaning:** "We're a team"

**When to use it:** To remind each other you're partners.

## Moving Forward

### Hur kan vi undvika det h√§r i framtiden?
**Pronunciation:** hoor kahn vee oond-VEE-kah deh hair ee FRAHM-tee-den

**Meaning:** "How can we avoid this in the future?"

**When to use it:** To focus on growth.

### Jag lovar att bli b√§ttre
**Pronunciation:** yahg LOH-var aht blee BET-reh

**Meaning:** "I promise to be better"

**When to use it:** To commit to positive change.

## Swedish Reconciliation Style

Swedes often value calm, measured reconciliation over emotional displays. A sincere, thoughtful apology may carry more weight than dramatic gestures.

The concept of "lagom" (balance, moderation) applies to making up too. Finding middle ground and practical solutions matters.

Quality time together‚Äîa quiet walk, fika (coffee break), or simply being together‚Äîhelps restore harmony and connection.

## Restoring Balance

"Jag √§lskar dig" (I love you) spoken sincerely after making up is meaningful in Swedish. The goal is returning to calm, balanced connection where both partners feel heard and valued.
